thread.title: Hero MotoCorp reports 33 pct rise in Q1 profit
thread.title_full: Hero MotoCorp reports 33 pct rise in Q1 profit | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Hero MotoCorp reports 33 pct rise in Q1 profit
text:
Other Articles Beijing to ban half its cars for 1 month to cut pollution Ford India sales decline 14% at 13,116 units in July Mahindra Thar vs Force Gurkha vs Maruti Gypsy: Face-off of the off-roaders Hero MotoCorp Ltd, the world’s largest seller of two-wheelers, posted a 33 percent rise in its fiscal first quarter net profit, beating analyst expectations.
The company, which sells about one in every two motorbikes in India – mainly in the countryside, said profit in the June quarter rose to 7.50 billion rupees ($117.3 million), up from 5.63 billion rupees a year earlier.
Analysts on average expected the company to post a profit of 6.83 billion rupees for the quarter.
Net sales of the company, however, fell marginally to 68.56 billion rupees from roughly 70 billion rupees in the same period last year, said a company statement issued to the stock exchanges.
First Published on August 03, 2015 8:25 pm
